analysis_age: The job posting subtly discourages older candidates from applying by using language that implies the company is looking for young and new professionals, such as "perfect for those new to the industry" and "young, up-and-coming professionals". This language creates an age bias with a negative polarity, implying that older candidates may not be suitable for the role.
text:
Company: Dorsey Group

Job Title: Edge Engineer

Job Description:
We're looking for an Edge Engineer to join our team at Dorsey Group! As a cutting-edge technology firm, we're perfect for those new to the industry who are eager to learn and grow with us. Our ideal candidate is a young, up-and-coming professional with a passion for innovation and a knack for thinking outside the box.

Responsibilities:

 Design, develop, and deploy edge computing solutions
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize project requirements
 Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in edge computing

Qualifications and Experience:
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
 1-2 years of experience in edge computing or a related field
 Strong understanding of edge computing concepts and technologies
 Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Perks and Benefits:
We offer a competitive salary package, with a range of $80,000 to $110,000 USD per year, based on your experience and skills. We're committed to fair and equitable pay practices. You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement savings, and paid time off. Plus, you'll get to work with a dynamic team of innovators who are shaping the future of technology!
